how do you guys automate pulling files from a market listener deployed on an s3 bucket?

elements.text: how do you guys automate pulling files from a market listener deployed on an s3 bucket?

text: Seems to be the same as people here already worked out, but if anyone wants confirmation, I asked Neil at Betfair about using marketBaseRate of 10 to filter races with turnover charge and here was his response:

elements.text: Seems to be the same as people here already worked out, but if anyone wants confirmation, I asked Neil at Betfair about using marketBaseRate of 10 to filter races with turnover charge and here was his response:

text:
Hi Alex

Thanks for getting in touch.

Yes, this is correct - see <https://www.betfair.com.au/hub/commissions-and-charges/|https://www.betfair.com.au/hub/commissions-and-charges/>

The 10% market base rate does however apply to all NSW horse racing markets (including non-Thoroughbred NSW races), so this is fine if you’re not interested in betting on those.

See further advice below:

· Identify the NSW tracks based on their abbreviation/venue name (sent via the API) against the full list of tracks provided via <https://docs.developer.betfair.com/display/1smk3cen4v3lu3yomq5qye0ni/Additional+Information#AdditionalInformation-RacecourseAbbreviations|https://docs.developer.betfair.com/display/1smk3cen4v3lu3yomq5qye0ni/Additional+Information#AdditionalInformation-RacecourseAbbreviations>
· Identify the non-Thoroughbred NSW races from the market name returned via the API.
Any races that include 'Trot' or 'Pace' in the market name can be excluded from the Turnover charge,
· Check the marketDescription field for the following text string "This is a Racing NSW Turnover Charge market" text in the market description.

Kind Regards,

Neil

Betfair Developer Program

attachments.title: Betfair Commission and Charges | Your State By State Guide
attachments.text: Betfair Commission is the only charge that the majority of customers on Betfair will ever have to pay. Each market that you bet on has a Market Base Rate (MBR). This Rate is the maximum percentage of your winnings that you will pay in commission.
attachments.fallback: Betfair: Betfair Commission and Charges | Your State By State Guide

· Check the marketDescription field for the following text string "This is a Racing NSW Turnover Charge market" text in the market description.

Kind Regards,

Neil

Betfair Developer Program

text: Hi, is there a way to apply InPlayOnly on trading.betting.list_event_types or market_filter?

elements.text: Hi, is there a way to apply InPlayOnly on trading.betting.list_event_types or market_filter?

text:
Yes, there is
```list_market_catalogue(
                filter=filters.market_filter(
                    in_play_only=True,```
Is that what you meant?

I think you mean this:

```market_filter = streaming_market_filter(
    turn_in_play_enabled=True)```

I am trying to get high resolution pricing data on available to back/lay. This is the call that I am using:
```list_market_book(market_ids=[market_id],
                                                       price_projection=filters.price_projection(
                                                           rollover_stakes=True,
                                                           ex_best_offers_overrides=filters.ex_best_offers_overrides(
                                                               rollup_model="STAKE",
                                                               best_prices_depth=3,
                                                               rollup_limit=0,
                                                           ),
                                                           price_data=filters.price_data(ex_best_offers=True, ),
                                                       ),```
But the price data that I am getting is not more precise than the minimum bet size.

Is this as expected or is there a way to get higher resolution (other than scraping the website)?

text: Also, why are you using `rollover_stakes=True`?
`rollup_model='NONE'` doesn’t do it. E.g. <https://www.betfair.com/exchange/plus/e-sports/market/1.170652449> I don’t see the available to lay 2€ at 1.38 but I see 13.99 at 1.39

elements.text: I don’t see the available to lay 2€ at 1.38 but I see 13.99 at 1.39

text: But maybe betfair is intentionally not showing stakes that are at or below the minimum bet size?

elements.text: But maybe betfair is intentionally not showing stakes that are at or below the minimum bet size?

text: <https://docs.developer.betfair.com/display/1smk3cen4v3lu3yomq5qye0ni/Betting+Enums#BettingEnums-RollupModel>

elements.text:
NONE
	

No rollup will be applied. However the volumes will be filtered by currency specific minimum stake unless overridden specifically for the channel.

text: Great, thanks
Because that information I am looking at anyway as a signal :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Because that information I am looking at anyway as a signal

text: As opposed to rollover_stakes=False
